snippet: Romeo Langlois, who was working for a French television channel, disappeared on April 28 after a gunfight involving FARC guerrillas, who claimed Sunday to have him in custody.
abstract: FARC guerrillas claim to have French journalist Romeo Langlois, who disappeared on April 28 during Colombian military and police forces anti-drug raid, in custody.

byline.contributor: Jenny Carolina González contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Romeo Langlois, who was working for a French television channel, disappeared on April 28 after a gunfight involving FARC guerrillas, who claimed Sunday to have him in custody.

headline.seo: Colombia Rebels Confirm Kidnapping of French Journalist
headline.main: Rebels Hold French Journalist in Colombia
